doc.after: Critics have remarked on BuÃ±uel's predilection for developing a surrealist mise-en-scÃ¨ne through use of a deceptively sparse naturalism,[258] as Michael Atkinson has put it: "visually Spartan and yet spasming with bouts of the irrational."[259] BuÃ±uel's visual style has been generally characterized as highly functional and uncluttered, with extraneous detail eliminated on sets to focus on character-defining elements.[260]
